column4: i heard there is a specific type of ubuntu that is designed to make online videos play correctly right off the bat? anyone know the name of that ubuntu or has antone tried it?
just dl Adobe Flash Player and uninstall swfc
ubninstall swfc - it blocks much of the flash content and freaks out adobe
ok is that how it is listed in my add remove...swfe?
make sure GNASH SWF Viewer is unistalled and also Swfdec Flash player
looking in my add/remove file now thanks
just type in flah in the search bar
yes did it, shows adobe and movie player
went back, clicked on all, put in the word flash and 3 came up now (media came in now with them)
in the upper-left there is a dropdown, it has options for which universes it is looking at. selest all available applications
yes, i did ALL, installed programs, then typed in flash, then it shows 3 of em
they will stay there unchecked
if i uncheck then will their names still appear in there incase i want them back someday?
were they checked?
it may be a driver issue
what graphics card do you have and what sound card?
8mb ati and the sound was turtle neachmontego but when i wiped w98 clean and put in ubuntu i did not put the sound CD thing in, but my sound is great thru my altec lansings
I ran into SEVERE issues with my ATI HDMI setup, but my audio and video come through the same digital dat-stream
telling 'nix to do it is key though!
can I pm you?
sure
